title: Defining Standard Vertex Form
text: The standard vertex form of an equation is in the form $$f(x)={a\left(x-h\right)}^2+k$$.

title: Completing the Square
text: To find the value of the binomial term being squared, observe the coefficient of the $$x$$ term in the equation.

title: Identifying Unknowns
text: What should the value of $$h$$ be in $$f(x)={a\left(x-h\right)}^2$$ so we get $$2$$ as the coefficient of the $$x$$ term after expansion?

title: Identifying Unknowns
text: What should the value of a be in $$f(x)={a\left(x-h\right)}^2+k$$ if the coefficient of the $$x^2$$ term is 1?

title: Constant in Completing the Square
text: Add or subtract a constant outside of the binomial term being squared to equate the binomial expansion with the original equation.

title: Calculating Constant
text: What constant do we need to add or subtract to get from $$1$$ to -3?
